acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of Andrew J. Provost, Jr., circa 1930.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Andrew J. Provost (1834-1925) was the descendant of David Provost, mayor of the town of Brooklyn (or Breuckelen) from 1698 to 1699, and for whom Provost Street in Brooklyn was named. Andrew J. Provost married Harriet Titas (1835-1910) in 1856 and eventually resided at 403 Washington Avenue in Brooklyn. He was Vice-President of the Citizens Committee of Greenpoint, which aided families of soldiers in the Army.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: One four-page manuscript written by Andrew J. Provost detailing the history of two oil paintings of Captain Pieter Praa and his daughter Christine, which Provost donated to the Long Island Historical Society (later the Brooklyn Historical Society) in 1898. A typed copy of the letter is also included.
